comment: Barry Bogan is awesome take him if you get a chance KSU ALUMNI
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I am a KSU graduate. Dr. Bogan was THE BEST professor I had. He has very high expectations for his students because he wants you to become THE best teacher you can be. He teaches in a way that challenges his students. He is a very inspirational educator who gives his students a "real" sense of what teaching is all about.

You will work like you never have before in this class. It takes a toll on your social life and sanity. However, it is totally worth it. Dr. Bogan teaches you like no other teacher does. He puts things into perspective, he is honest about everything, and wants you to work hard because being a teacher is not a job that just anyone can do. Good luck!

The hardest professor I've had but also the best. Very educated man, he knows what he is talking about and has high expectations. Tons of assignments, quizzes and readings. Very rigorous course but worth it! I have learned so much and am a better teacher because of this professor!

He is the hardest teacher I have had at KSU. With that being said, I learned more in his class than I have learned in any college course. He pushes you to learn and retain the information.If you want to become a WONDERFUL reading teacher, absolutly take him. You will hate it during the semester,but after the class is over you will be thanking him.

He is hard but so good. I was able to take and pass my Reading Specialization on the first try just by taking his class and reading his notes!! He is great!(A little Scary at first but his not so bad)
Best professor ever! There are a ton of assignments due but he is one of the few professors at KSU that actually knows what he is talking about!

DO NOT take this professor. He is EXTREMELY rude, inconsiderate,arrogant, and is not willing to work with you on anything. He gives a ton of assignments and grades very harshly. I did learn a lot from the class but I will never ever take him again, there was an unnecessarily large amount of work.Horrible.

Intimidating at first, but I learned so much. He will have you do random presentations, questions, and a quiz on every chapter. Know the material, don't miss class, and put effort into your work and you will do fine! This is not a lazy persons class. If you want to learn how to be a great reading teacher Dr. Bogan will get you there!

So far, this is the ONLY class Ive taken at KSU where Ive actually learned something about education. He grades tough, but he prepares you for the midterm and final, and you have fun in class too. He will call you out to answer questions and do demonstrations, but it gets easier as time goes on, and it makes you a better teacher.
He has prepared me for my job as a teacher. He is challenging but SOOOOO worth it!
The best teacher I've ever had. He is tough but I learned so much!!!!!!!!! LOVE HIM!!!!!

Dr. Bogan is one of the best! He knows what he's talking about, he pushes his students to really bring up their game. Being in front of the class builds your confidence, although it's painful at first. He's very helpful if you approach him, but he also has high standards for students; he wants them to be their very best. Noting wrong with that.

Dr. Bogan is the best teacher I have had at KSU.  I have learned SO MUCH from him. He balances high expectations with fairness and compassion better than any teacher I know.  He is a consummate professional who models the behavior he expects his students to display. I wish I could take all my courses from him.

He is the worst professor I've ever had. I would drop him in a heart beat if I wasn't stuck in a cohort. This guy is not worth the stress. If you have a job or a family he does not care. He gives tons of extra assignments that are not included in the syllabus. If his ego was any bigger his head might exploded. Do NOT take this professor!

This was the worst class I've ever taken! He thinks his class is your only class, and he will test you every week. He will also give you tons of difficult projects. In addition, Class is Mandatory and he will make you get up in front of class constantly. I've been in school for 3yrs and this is the first class I dropped. Run!
Below average professor, below average class!

AMAZING. Best reading teacher at KSU. He tries to intimidate because he thinks it's funny, but stand your ground and he'll respect you. I learned more in his class than any other. It's a lot of work, but you will retain the info and you will be glad you took him!
The best professor at KSU!!  He sets the standard high and he expects you to reach it.  I learned 10 times more in his classes than I learned on the other two reading classes combined.

The material in the class itself is not too hard, just follow the rubric and you'll get an A.  The class can be a little challenging because he will randomly call on you to talk in class (you can use your notes).  Overall, not a bad class.
He's hard but you learn alot

If your want to learn about teaching children to read, this is the professor have. He loves the subject and you learn from the class. In this class you are gaining knowledge. Yes! he set a standard you are not going to make an A just because... you have to put in some effort.
Loved this class!
As a previous poster said, he is intimidating but actually quite nice when you actually talk to him. It's a lot of work but you learn a lot and he's very fair.

He is very intimidating and the class is alot of work. But although it seems really hard it is actually pretty easy to get an A in it. For the midterm and final he reads you the test before and so you know exactly what to study for. And you learn alot in his class.
No Comments
